column4: because that patch is _huge_ -- very intrusive -- and doesn't apply cleanly with the thousands of patches we have
but that is something crucial for audio
you can still compile your own from kernel.org, then, as ubuntustudio.com suggests
that's what I just did but alsa-driver will freeze my machine if I try to compile it
then you'll need to compile in a non-RT kernel against the RT headers
anyhow, I was asking for more software specifics, as in which version of which RT patch against which source, etc.
have you reported it upstream, then?
I'm not shure what is the problem, dunno what to report
you just told me what the problem is :)
yeah but it could be something wrong with my laptop
now what _I_ would do before posting to lkml is to ensure that I _can_ compile alsa-driver modules while running a non-RT kernel
what about a vanilla kernel.org one without RT?
have not tryed without the patch
